why: Primary baseline: survey-based real rate on linear time trend (full sample 1980Q1-2015Q3)
HC1 robust SEs -- same coefficient as baseline with heteroskedasticity-robust inference
HC2 robust SEs -- finite-sample corrected robust inference
HC3 robust SEs -- most conservative heteroskedasticity-robust inference
Newey-West HAC with 4 lags -- accounts for serial correlation in time-series data
Newey-West HAC with 8 lags -- more conservative serial correlation correction
Newey-West HAC with 12 lags -- very conservative serial correlation correction
Block bootstrap SE (block=8) -- nonparametric inference preserving serial dependence
Residual bootstrap SE -- nonparametric inference under i.i.d. residual assumption
TIPS-based real rate as alternative outcome -- tests whether decline holds in market-based measure
TIPS-based real rate with Newey-West SEs -- combines alternative outcome with HAC inference
Tests whether TIPS and survey measures diverge over time -- a different question than the decline itself
Average of TIPS and survey measures -- composite outcome variable on overlap period
4-quarter moving average of survey rate -- smoothed outcome reduces noise
8-quarter moving average of survey rate -- more aggressive smoothing
20-quarter moving average -- tests trend in underlying slow-moving component
HP-filtered trend (lambda=1600) -- standard business cycle decomposition
HP-filtered trend (lambda=100) -- less smooth trend component
Standardized (z-scored) outcome -- rescaled units only; same t-stat as baseline
Pre-2008 subsample -- tests whether decline existed before the financial crisis
Post-2000 subsample -- tests decline in recent period
1980s decade subsample -- tests within-decade decline
1990s decade subsample -- weakest decade (p=0.03) but still significant
2000s decade subsample -- steepest within-decade decline
2010s subsample (2010Q1-2015Q3) -- shortest subsample (N=23)
Full sample excluding 1980s -- tests whether 1980s drive the result
Full sample excluding 1990s -- tests stability to dropping flattest decade
Full sample excluding 2000s -- tests whether 2000s decline drives the result
TIPS pre-GFC (1999Q2-2007Q4) -- decline in market-based measure before crisis
TIPS post-GFC (2008Q1-2015Q3) -- decline continues post-crisis
Survey-based rate on TIPS overlap period (1999Q2-2015Q3) -- comparable sample to TIPS
Trimmed 5th-95th percentile -- removes extreme observations
Winsorized at 5th/95th percentile -- caps rather than drops extremes
Trimmed 1st-99th percentile -- mild outlier removal
Semi-annual data (Q2 and Q4 only) -- tests at lower frequency
Q4 observations only -- annual frequency at year-end
Q1 observations only -- annual frequency at year-start
Annual averaged data -- aggregation to annual frequency
Annual averaged data with Newey-West SEs -- combines frequency change with HAC
Annual averaged TIPS data -- TIPS measure at annual frequency
Non-overlapping 5-year averages (N=8) -- very low frequency trend test
Quadratic trend specification -- tests whether decline is accelerating
Cubic trend specification -- tests higher-order nonlinearity in decline
Log-transformed dependent variable -- tests proportional rather than absolute decline
Log(time) as predictor -- tests concave time pattern (decline slowing over time)
Piecewise linear with break at 2000 -- tests whether slope changes at millennium
Piecewise linear with break at 2008 -- tests whether slope changes at GFC
Reports the post-2008 slope change coefficient from piecewise model -- tests acceleration rather than level
Trend in first differences -- tests whether rate of decline changes over time (different question)
Mean first difference -- tests whether average quarterly change is nonzero (different question: quarterly significance vs long-run trend)
Demeaned by decade then regressed on trend -- mechanically removes between-decade variation which is the primary source of the decline
AR(1) lagged dependent variable control -- tests trend persistence conditional on recent level
AR(2) lagged dependent variable controls -- allows richer dynamics
AR(4) lagged dependent variable controls -- full year of quarterly lag dynamics
Calendar year as predictor instead of years-since-1980 -- numerically identical coefficient to baseline (rescaled time)
Post-2000 level shift dummy -- tests whether mean rate dropped after 2000 (different treatment: level shift vs continuous trend)
Post-2008 level shift dummy -- tests whether mean rate dropped after GFC (different treatment: level shift vs continuous trend)
Trend with post-2008 dummy and interaction -- the linear trend coefficient is the pre-2008 trend
25th percentile quantile regression -- tests decline at lower end of rate distribution
50th percentile (median) regression -- robust to outliers in level
75th percentile quantile regression -- tests decline at upper end
Huber M-estimation -- robust to outliers in residuals
GLS with AR(1) errors -- efficient estimation under serial correlation
GLS with AR(2) errors -- efficient estimation with richer error dynamics
WLS weighted by inverse decade variance -- downweights volatile decades
Theil-Sen nonparametric slope estimator -- fully robust to outliers
Stacked TIPS + survey measures with interaction -- tests whether two measures share same trend (different outcome structure)
TIPS with quadratic trend -- nonlinearity in market-based measure
Decade dummy model reporting 2010s coefficient vs 1980s base -- level shift rather than continuous trend
Decade dummy model reporting 2000s coefficient vs 1980s base -- level shift rather than continuous trend
Decade dummy model reporting 1990s coefficient vs 1980s base -- level shift rather than continuous trend
